title: All Saints Episcopal Church (Jacksonville)
text:
All Saints Episcopal Church is an <a href="Episcopal%20Church%20%28United%20States%29">Episcopal</a> church and <a href="parish">parish</a> in the <a href="San%20Marco%20%28Jacksonville%29">San Marco</a> district of <a href="Jacksonville%2C%20Florida">Jacksonville, Florida</a>. The parish is in the <a href="Episcopal%20Diocese%20of%20Florida">Episcopal Diocese of Florida</a>. The congregation marked its <a href="quasquicentennial">quasquicentennial</a> on <a href="All%20Saints%20Sunday">All Saints Sunday</a>, November 7, 2010.
Current church.
All Saints Episcopal Church is a mid-sized parish with approximately 400 members. It is the only Episcopal church in the San Marco neighborhood of Jacksonville, Florida. The parish's <a href="Rector%20%28ecclesiastical%29">rector</a> is <a href="The%20Reverend">The Reverend</a> Donavan Cain.
"Music Through the Ages" concert series.
All Saints Episcopal Church hosts an annual late fall through early spring <a href="classical%20music">classical music</a> series entitled "Music Through the Ages." The free <a href="concert">concert</a> series features both locally and nationally known <a href="Chamber%20music">chamber</a> and classical music groups. The most high-profile groups scheduled to perform in the 2011/2012 concert series are the <a href="Ritz%20Chamber%20Players">Ritz Chamber Players</a> and <a href="American%20Boychoir%20School">American Boychoir</a>. One of the yearly events in the series, always held during <a href="Advent">Advent</a>, is "a service of lessons and carols", patterned after <a href="King%27s%20College%2C%20Cambridge">King's College, Cambridge</a>'s "<a href="Nine%20Lessons%20and%20Carols">Nine Lessons and Carols</a>. "Music Through the Ages" is organized by the church's <a href="music%20director">music director</a> and <a href="organist">organist</a>, <a href="Dr.">Dr.</a> Michael Mastronicola.
Intergenerational care center.
All Saints Early Learning and Care Center, on the parish's campus, is an <a href="intergenerational%20shared%20site">intergenerational shared site</a> ministry that provides <a href="daycare">daycare</a> for children (6 months to 5 years), <a href="special%20needs">special needs</a> children (3 to 5 years), special needs adults (18+) and <a href="senior%20citizens">senior citizens</a>. It is the first intergenerational daycare center in the <a href="Southeastern%20United%20States">Southeast</a>. The care center is a private non-profit corporation funded by <a href="Title%2020%20of%20the%20United%20States%20Code">Title XX</a>, the State of Florida, the <a href="United%20Way%20of%20America">United Way</a>, private contributions, and fees paid by participants.
